intro: Rhodiola tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is well adapted to cold, arid environments and can thrive at elevations above 3,000 meters. It is often found growing in rocky soils and alpine meadows. Rhodiola tibetica is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional Tibetan medicine.
